title: rust-lld crashes on rust:1.52-alpine container (but not rust:1.52)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: O-Arm
labels.description: Target: 32-bit Arm processors (armv6, armv7, thumb...), including 64-bit Arm in AArch32 state

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

### Code

I have a no-std project for a Cortex-M7, which is not open source. The project compiles fine on Ubuntu and on the rust:1.52 container, but I get a crash in rust-lld on the rust:1.52-alpine container. The container used to work fine, but clearly I added something to my code today that has upset it.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

It's the official rust:1.52-alpine container.

### Error output

```console
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build --target=thumbv7em-none-eabihf
error: linking with `rust-lld` failed: signal: 11 (core dumped)
 |
 = note: "rust-lld" "-flavor" "gnu" "--eh-frame-hdr" "-plugin-opt=O0" "-plugin-opt=mcpu=cortex-m7"...."--nmagic" "-Tlink.x" "-Tdefmt.x" "-Bdynamic"
 = note: PLEASE submit a bug report to https://bugs.llvm.org/ and include the crash backtrace.
```

(I've snipped the object list as the filenames are confidential).
